intro: Gilia ocellata, commonly known as the spotted gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers with a distinctive white or yellow spot at the base. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Gilia ocellata produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
